Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: 2. Analyze the Input Data: * Format: Timestamp, Action Type, Attributes (App, Window, Keys/Action/Direction, etc.). * Time Range: 2024-12-11T08:59:50 to 09:08:15 (approx. 8.5 minutes). * Applications: Microsoft Word, Google Chrome, Adobe Acrobat, Microsoft Excel. * Windows/Documents: Quarterly_Report.docx, Document1.docx, Email - Inbox, Report_Draft.pdf, Budget_2024.xlsx. * Actions: FOCUS, TYPING, SAVE, SWITCH, CLICK, SCROLL, HIGHLIGHT, CLOSE.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: 3. Determine Case Identification Strategy (The Case Concept): * Option A: One big case per user per day. (Too coarse. Hides the distinct tasks being performed). * Option B: One case per application switch. (Too fragmented. A task often involves switching apps, e.g., copying from Excel to Word). * Option C: One case per document/task. (Most logical for process mining office work).

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Analysis of Flow: 1. User starts with Quarterly_Report.docx (Focus). 2. Switches to Document1.docx (Focus + Typing + Save). This looks like drafting a specific document. 3. Switches to Chrome (Email - Inbox). Reads/Sends email about Annual Meeting. This is a distinct communication task. 4. Switches to Acrobat (Report_Draft.pdf). Reviewing. 5. Switches to Excel (Budget_2024.xlsx). Updating figures. 6. Switches back to Document1.docx. Adding reference to budget. Saving. Closing. -> Connection: The Excel work fed into Document1.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - IND
Text: Decision: I will group events into cases based on the primary artifact (document) being worked on. * Case 1: Document1.docx (Drafting & Finalizing). Includes the interlude with Excel... * Case 2: Email - Inbox (Handling Annual Meeting Email). * Case 3: Report_Draft.pdf (Reviewing). * Case 4: Quarterly_Report.docx (Finalizing Quarterly Report).

Name: Backtracking - PE
Text: Revised Case Strategy: To make it analyst-friendly, I should group contiguous work on a specific logical goal. * Critique: Merging Email and Acrobat into the Document case might be noise... * Better Approach: Group by Session/Task Topic. * Case 1: Drafting_Document1... * Simplification for Process Mining: ... * Case 101: Drafting_Document1 (Includes Word Document1 + Excel Budget...)

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Refinement on Excel: Since the user switches from Excel directly to Document1 to Insert reference, the Excel activity is functionally part of the Document1 creation process. I will assign Excel events to the Document1 Case ID to reflect this dependency.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: 4. Determine Activity Naming: * Raw actions (FOCUS, TYPING, CLICK) are too granular. * Need semantic names. * FOCUS + TYPING -> Edit Document or Draft Content. * SAVE -> Save Document. * CLICK (Open Email) -> Open Email. * Standardization: * Word Typing -> Edit Content * Word Save -> Save Version * Email Open/Read -> Read Message * Email Reply/Send -> Reply to Message * Excel Typing -> Update Data * PDF Scroll/Highlight -> Review Material

Name: Validation - PE
Text: 5. Drafting the Event Log (Mental or Scratchpad): * Case 1: Drafting_Doc1 * 09:00:00 Focus/Start -> Start Drafting * ... * Exclusion: I will exclude raw SWITCH and SCROLL events unless... * Merging: Multiple TYPING events... * Actually, looking at the timestamps... * Excel Integration: I need to be careful... * Decision: ... merging Excel into Case 001.

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: Noise Reduction: SWITCH events removed (they are transitions, not activities). Initial FOCUS treated as Open/Start. * Chronology: The final table must be sorted by Timestamp.

Name: Backtracking - PE
Text: *(Self-Correction during drafting)*: Should I merge the two Word Document1 sessions into one case even though there are intervening cases? Yes... *Decision:* I will assign Case_001 to Document1 (including Excel). ... *One final check on Case 001:* Is it better to keep Excel separate? ... Given the explicit text Inserting reference to budget... merging them tells a stronger process story... I will proceed with merging Excel into Case 001. *One final check on Case 004:* The gap... This is acceptable.
